Need help reading this?

Intro

Installable via npm install --save libp2p-webrtc-star, it can also be used directly in the browser.

Download

The source is available for download from GitHub. Alternatively, you can install using npm:

$ npm install --save libp2p-webrtc-star

You can then require() libp2p-webrtc-star as normal:

const libp2PWebrtcStar = require('libp2p-webrtc-star')

In the Browser

Libp2p-webrtc-star should work in any ES2015 environment out of the box.

Usage:

<script type="text/javascript" src="index.js"></script>

The portable versions of libp2p-webrtc-star, including index.js and index.min.js, are included in the /dist folder. Libp2p-webrtc-star can also be found on unpkg.com under

  • https://unpkg.com/libp2p-webrtc-star/dist/index.min.js
  • https://unpkg.com/libp2p-webrtc-star/dist/index.js

Connection: An upgraded Connection
▸ createListener(options = {}, handler)
src/index.js

Creates a WebrtcStar listener. The provided handler function will be called anytime a new incoming Connection has been successfully upgraded via upgrader.upgradeInbound.

createListener(options: object?, handler: function (Connection)): Listener
Parameters
options (object? = {}) simple-peer options for listener
handler (function (Connection))
Returns
Listener: A WebrtcStar listener
▸ filter(multiaddrs)
src/index.js

Takes a list of Multiaddrs and returns only valid TCP addresses

filter(multiaddrs: Array<Multiaddr>): Array<Multiaddr>
Parameters
multiaddrs (Array<Multiaddr>)
Returns
Array<Multiaddr>: Valid TCP multiaddrs
